Class Controller

java.lang.Object
org.example.galaxy_trucker.Controller.Controller
Direct Known Subclasses:
CardsController, CheckValidityController, ChoosePositionController, FlightController, LoginController, PostPrepController, PrepController
public abstract class Controller extends Object
The Controller class is an abstract representation of the game's state management and player interaction. It handles game actions, transitions between states, and manages interactions with exceptions and player connection statuses. Each concrete implementation of this class defines specific behaviors for different phases or mechanics of the game.

  • Constructor Details

    • Controller

      public Controller()

  • Method Details

    • action

      public void action(Command command, GameController gc)
      Executes the provided command for the current player and manages the state transition in the game controller. If the command is not allowed in the player's current state, an exception is sent to the exception listener. If an error occurs during the command execution, the player's board is rolled back to its previous state, and an exception is sent to the exception listener.
      Parameters:
      command - The command to be executed. This determines the action to be performed by the player.
      gc - The game controller responsible for changing the state after the command is executed.

    • DefaultAction

      public void DefaultAction(GameController gc)
      Executes the default action for the current player based on their state and the provided game controller.
      Parameters:
      gc - the game controller to manage the game state and execute transitions; it may be null, in which case certain operations will be handled differently

    • setDisconnected

      public void setDisconnected(boolean disconnected)
      Sets the disconnected state of the controller.
      Parameters:
      disconnected - a boolean indicating whether the controller is disconnected (true) or connected (false).

    • nextState

      public abstract void nextState(GameController gc)
      Advances the game to its next state by processing the current game context and determining the appropriate transition.
      Parameters:
      gc - the GameController instance managing the current game state and actions

    • setExceptionListener

      public void setExceptionListener(ExceptionListener exceptionListener)
      Sets the ExceptionListener to handle exception events.
      Parameters:
      exceptionListener - the ExceptionListener instance to be set. This listener will handle exception events generated within the system.

    • removeExceptionListener

      public void removeExceptionListener()
      Removes the current exception listener, if any, by setting it to null. This effectively disables the handling of exceptions via the exception listener mechanism.

    • sendException

      public void sendException(Exception e)
      Sends an exception event through the exception listener if it is not null. If the listener is null, logs a message indicating the absence of a listener.
      Parameters:
      e - the exception to be processed and sent to the listener

    • getDisconnected

      public boolean getDisconnected()
      Retrieves the disconnected state of the controller.
      Returns:
      true if the controller is currently in a disconnected state, false otherwise.
